intro: Flyriella sphenopoda, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flyriella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Flyriella sphenopoda is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
